#13

jojojo

JoJoJoJoJoJoJo

Joined

Aug 18, 2007

Messages

38,843

Location

Varies

He's a lovely player to watch. His significance to Madrid is that he's a good third man in a three man midfield, and a good worker #10 when they're playing a 2 man midfield. Ozil's a better #10, but he was pretty inflexible, and was usually invisible when they tried to play him out wide.

Plus, and this is the big one, he's Spanish. He could be the next Iniesta. He could be the first Spanish Ballon D'Or. So, no pressure on the 21 year old there.

Is he a poor subsitiute for Ozil. Most players would be poor substitutes for Ozil at the things Ozil's good at, but Madrid's midfield were misfiring until Alonso came back. Modric didn't step into the role and it's too early (or not possible?) for Illarramendi.

Right now, he's all about potential but he's still got 6 goals and 4 assists in 13 Liga starts for Madrid. Ozil got 9 goals and 13 assists in the whole of last season. Stats never tell the whole story, but I don't think he's doing bad for a potential player.

None of your fecking business

Real Madrid

Who is this Jese who is ridiculously talented?

Jesé Rodriguez, a young perfectly two footed winger who can play behind the striker and has a nose for goals. He's been playing for Real Madrid Castilla for a few years and has been a regular for the first team since the start of this season.

Mourinho already called him up a few times last season. Has consistently been one of the standout players for the younger Spanish national teams for years.

This World cup comes a little bit too soon but I fully expect him to be integrated in the first team for the next European cup.

He's really got bags of potential, the only downside is that we have Ronaldo playing on his favourite position, so we'll have to see how that will pan out in the future.

Playing very well right now).
